mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic review of the genus Erythrocricus Schubart, 1962 (Diplopoda, Spirobolida, Rhinocricidae)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Erythrocricus Schubart, 1962: 69
, as subgenus of
Rhinocricus Karsch, 1881

Rhinocricus ( Erythrocricus ) sanguineostriatus
–
Marek et al. 2003: 71
.

Species of
Erythrocricus
differ from other rhinocricid genera by the combination of the following characters: both males and females have a transverse red line on body rings ( Figs 1B, D–F , 3C–D ), males present a sternite of the anterior gonopods triangular in anterior view and a rounded coxite ( Figs 2A , 5A ), each posterior gonopod has the external branch folded over the solenomere ( Figs 2C , 5C ).
